messages.page_content:
Topic: Roll Call
Summary: The roll call was conducted, and the following council members were present: Giarrusso, Green, Harris, King, Moreno (President), Morrell (Vice President), and Thomas.
UID: 878e684c-047f-46fa-9a27-461ff0ec1423

- Topic: Recognition of Swin Cash as 2022 NBA Hall of Fame Inductee
- Summary: The New Orleans City Council recognized Swin Cash, the Vice President of Basketball Operations and Team Development for the NBA Pelicans, as a 2022 NBA Hall of Fame inductee.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: Recognition and celebration of Swin Cash's achievement.
- Tags/Keywords: Swin Cash, NBA, Hall of Fame, recognition
- UID: 373354cf-e1c3-4b59-a05d-63f9ca35692c

- Topic: Recognition of Music and Culture Coalition New Orleans 10-Year Anniversary
- Summary: The council recognized the Music and Culture Coalition New Orleans in honor of its 10-year anniversary.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: Recognition of the organization's milestone.
- Tags/Keywords: Music and Culture Coalition, anniversary, recognition
- UID: 373354cf-e1c3-4b59-a05d-63f9ca35692c

- Topic: Celebration of Omega Psi Phi Fraternity, Inc. 111th Anniversary
- Summary: The council recognized the Omega Psi Phi Fraternity and celebrated its commitment to academia and intellectual achievement in honor of its 111th anniversary.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: Recognition and celebration of the fraternity's milestone.
- Tags/Keywords: Omega Psi Phi Fraternity, anniversary, recognition
- UID: 373354cf-e1c3-4b59-a05d-63f9ca35692c

- Topic: Communications related to electric and gas utility matters
- Summary: The transmittal document for communications related to electric and gas utility matters was submitted by Erin Spears, Chief of Staff & Counsel, Council Utilities Regulatory Office (CURO). It included various communications from Entergy New Orleans, LLC and other organizations regarding power station usage reports, comments, and entry of appearances.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: The communications were received by the Council of the City of New Orleans.
- Tags/Keywords: Electric and gas utility, Entergy New Orleans, communication, Council Utilities Regulatory Office
- UID: 18245a01-9fb3-48c4-8a47-ea3150ced678

- Topic: Amendment to the Classified Pay Plan for Sewerage & Water Board
- Summary: Amy B. Trepagnier, Director of Personnel, submitted an Amendment to the Classified Pay Plan for the Sewerage & Water Board, including new classifications and their corresponding annual hiring rates.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A - (ELECTRONICALLY SUBMITTED)
- Decision/Key Actions: Submission of Amendment to Classified Pay Plan
- Tags/Keywords: Classified Pay Plan, Sewerage & Water Board, Amendment
- UID: 6cb7ffdb-393e-47b0-a815-638bd96902ce

- Topic: Amendment to Civil Service Rules (Merit Pay)
- Summary: The Director of Personnel, Amy B. Trepagnier, submitted an Amendment to the Civil Service Rules (Merit Pay) in accordance with Article X, Section 10 of the Constitution of Louisiana. The amendment outlines annual merit-based payments for classified employees who exceed expectations. It also includes a budget allocation of two percent of the combined base rates of pay for all permanent classified positions and specifies a 25% across-the-board pay increase for employees with exceptional performance evaluations.
- Ordinance Number: C4173
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: Received and Referred to the Budget Committee
- Decision/Key Actions: The amendment was received and referred to the Budget Committee for further review.
- Tags/Keywords: Civil Service Rules, Merit Pay, Budget Committee, Amendment
- UID: cfe56cdb-d6d6-4ef5-868f-41a072f0969f

- Topic: Merit Increase Payment for Employees
- Summary: The ordinance outlines the eligibility criteria and payment structure for merit increases for employees based on performance evaluations. It also specifies the consequences for supervisors who fail to administer the performance evaluation system correctly.
- Ordinance Number: Not specified
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (8 YEAS, 2 NAYS, 1 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with a majority vote, indicating support for the outlined criteria and payment structure for merit increases.
- Tags/Keywords: Merit Increase, Employee Performance, Payment Structure
- UID: 70680798-75e0-4148-87c5-420dbb902f5c

- Topic: IIJA Joint Council and Legislative Committee Report

- Topic: Amendment of 2022 Operating Budget for New Orleans
- Summary: This ordinance aimed to reduce the 2022 General Fund appropriation to the Department of Police and increase the appropriation to the Department of Sanitation to fund additional Sanitation expenses in 2022.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,967
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed, leading to the reallocation of funds as proposed.
- Tags/Keywords: Budget, Police, Sanitation, Funding, Reallocation
- UID: a8125d59-2e7c-4a7d-a2a9-a85c803e2ce6

- Topic: Amendment of 2022 Operating Budget for New Orleans

- Topic: Granting Conditional Use for Expansion of Existing Restaurant

- Ordinance Number: ZD NO. 75/22
- Votes Summary:
